Reviews.Title: “Ideally located, but.....................”
Reviews.Author: ALIGWALES
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Travelodge Thurs 8 March to Sun 11 March 2012. The Travelodge is ideally located- a 2 minute walk from Marylebone Tube Station. If like us, the tube line was closed on the Sunday due to engineering work, Baker Street Tube Station is only about a 5 min walk. We arrived at the Travelodge at 2pm, and were advised we could check in at 2.30pm, or pay £10 and check in at 2pm. We decided to wait until 2.30pm and had a drink in the bar. They have different offers on in the bar – 2 bottles of Stella Cidre for £6. When we went back to the bar later in the evening, the Stella Cidre offer had been removed. If they are going to change the offer, then please remove it from the your billboards and in the lift. When in the bar, the receptionist who also served us the drinks, came and took our documentation and then returned with our key card. We stayed on the 5th floor. The room was OK – double bed, 2 wardrobe spaces, only 1 wardrobe had a set a coat hangers, so it was good job we brought our own. Tea and coffee making facilities, which were re-stocked everyday. A small flat screen TV. The room was so hot, we had to turn off the heating (radiator) and kept the window open, I say open -ajar, as it would not open that far. The curtains were short and the light would come in – not ideal if you are trying to sleep, with a bright light glaring in. The bathroom- this has a lot to be desired. The shower had no power and when used the water would build up all over the windowsill. The bathroom window which overlooked offices, was distorted, to avoid prying eyes from outside. But beware, I would say you could still see the silhouette shape of your body when showering, The bath was held together by sealant, patched up to avoid further leaks. The toilet leaked and did not have a dual flush like most toilets in Travelodge. The bathroom needs a total refurb Room desperately needs a lick of paint, new carpet and new mattress. The bed dipped in the middle, so if you rolled over in the night, then you would sink in the middle! Check out time was 12pm, on the last day before we were due to vacate the room. We went out for a walk and when we came back to the room at 11.30am, only to find that we could not access our room. We went down to Reception where the card had to be re-registered. We didn’t experience any noise from our room, maybe some from outside, but we had the window open. Towels were changed every day Why do Travelodge only have 3 pillows- we learnt this from previous experience and asked when we first went up to our room for another pillow. Its not the Ritz, but good if you are on a budget and lets face it how much time do you actually stay in your room in London -so much to do!

Reviews.Title: “great for what I needed”
Reviews.Author: TheRoverMerseyside
Reviews.Content: booked this travelodge as it was only £25. I was in London attending a sporting event and wanted a central location were I could get my head down and leave my overnight bag, I did not want luxury and certainly didn't expect it for that proce, I just wanted a trip on low budget and this room gave it to me. Yes my singal room 115 was small, but it was warm comfy and clean, the bathroom again was small and the shower curtain got in the way when you used the toilet but the shower was powerful and hot. The bed was fairly comfy I managed to sleep in it (but I had, had a few pints when I got in it). My room was on the first floor by the lift and yes I could hear people coming and going but I was not affected by street noise. The staff were welcoming and freindly and check in was over in minutes. So if you intend to spend a lot of time in your room then maybe here is not the place for you, but if like me you just want a place to store your bag and get your head down in a centrally convienient location then its fine for the money. Not 5* but it was what I needed. I did not use the restaurant so I can not comment on this, I used the coffee bar across the road which did a good breakfast sandwhich. I would stay again if it was available to me in the travelodge price offer bracket of £20-£45.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Michael F
Reviews.Content: I paid over £100 for a single night, the room was not much wider than the cells in Alcatraz, I visited over Xmas, broken tiles, no shampoo, plastic loo seat, soap so cheap it would not lather, the knives and forks are the cheapest pressed steel so the handles actually cut into your hand, no alarm facility, few channels on the TV, broken bedside light hanging off, and a noisy generator outside. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, nothing like the pictures. I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst”
Reviews.Author: Andre V
Reviews.Content: I am at the hotel now. I booked 5 nights and was greeted politely and out in room 403 but there was a problem with the bathwater so I was moved to room 401 where the bathwater is also not properly hot and the shower head is broken. I reported this to the staff and was promised it would be fixed. The staff member was abrupt and nothing was done to remedy the situation, the shower head is still unusable. The radiator is so feeble that I had to wear a jersey in bed on 2 of the nights and the room was only service when I actuall asked for it to be done. Today (Sunday) the cleaner only left one towel for 2 people and never filled up the tea / coffee and sugar . He just left the dirty mugs and spoons and never even picked up the papers that had fallen out of the bin. One staff member, a Portguese fellow called Hugo and one other guy were helpful but I feel that my money was wasted and one staff member told me that hot water is a problem in this hotel, always. Every other guest I spoke to says that the water is an issue and that the staff need to learn to do a better job servicing the rooms and dealing with customer queries and complaints. Certainly NOT a place I want to come back to..

Reviews.Title: “Only worth it of you can get a cheap room”
Reviews.Author: Nutytart
Reviews.Content: Only reason we booked this hotel is because we were attending a wedding in Marylebone and this hotel was waaaay cheap for London at Â£131 for 3 nights Fri-Sun. The room was adequate, guess you always know the basic standard to expect at the travelodge. The room was very noisy as the road outside is busy with the station 24/7, so much so that I did find it hard to sleep the first night. We asked to be moved but no other rooms available. The bathroom was terrible, very small, dated and needed a very good clean. The location is great but unless you get the room for very cheap - like we did, I am sure you can get better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bathrooms in desperate need of a refurb.”
Reviews.Author: SCOTT2704
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge is in a great position and it's immediate surrounding area is one of the better areas of London. As for the hotel, the staff were fine and friendly and the corridors and communal looked ok too but even though the sleeping area of the room was acceptable, the bathroom certainly was not. From missing and stained ceiling tiles to damaged mirrors to broken tiles to ancient taps, it really desperately needs an upgrade. Basically the bathroom was held together with Silicone Sealant that looked like it had seen much better days too. The windows throughout we're also extremely poor and need upgrading immediately. I have stayed in dozens of Travelodge Hotels throughout the UK without a hitch but money needs to be spent here sooner rather than later however cheap the Rate was !!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the normal Travelodge standard”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHesky
Reviews.Content: Same prices as usual and similarly friendly staff (Travelodge staff seem to usually be quite good). Room furnishing was pretty standard and the menu is always the same. The location is convenient for the station and attractions around the Baker Street area. Things that let this one down were that the common areas varied from tired to scruffy and had a down at heel smell to them. Biggest complaint however is that most of the rooms face to the road and with single glazing you need to be a very sound sleeper to get a good nights rest.

Reviews.Title: “Yet again worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Geordie75_10
Reviews.Content: Booked this travelodge because of the location and we have stayed here a couple of times before so we knew what to expect. Yet again we got a good deal for the weekend throught the saver deals when they come out and we always choose this hotel because its so easy to get to via the tube, taxi or walking. We arrived at 2.30 to be told we were to early to check in but the guy behind the reception desk (HUGO) was really helpfull and told us to wait ten mins and he will sort us out. True to his word he did and had a sense of humour which you dont find that often in some other hotels in london. The room was fine but the bathroom needed an overhaul because it looked like a last minute botch job but the shower worked and so did the toilet so everything was ok. The single glazing window with the aluminium frames did let in some coldness but the heating was working so everything was cosy when we got back from a day out. The bed was comfortable and had a really good night sleep until the rubbish truck turned up outside to collect the tonne of glass bottles from the bar over the road that was not a nce wake up call but never mind. On the second day we decided to try the hotel bar for food and drink and we were pleasantly surprised with the food (burger and chips) the guy behind the bar makes it himself and was a little snowed under when two lots of families came along straight after each other, but he coped. drinks offer at the bar are not bad either. Everyone moans or picks faults with the rooms but you are in london in an economy hotel in the center of London so dont expect the ritz or savoy hotel standard. We recommend this hotel for a budget weekend when you basically just use the room as what it is a BEDROOM not a place to criticise or pick faults. we will be booking here again in the near future

Reviews.Title: “Monastery/Prison”
Reviews.Author: Cris L
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying here. While this hotel is in a great location, close to the station, and convenient for many other parts of London... I wouldnt reccomend staying here. Why? Simple the hotel is CRAP. It's old, tired and in desperate need of a renovation. Please start by blowing it up, and starting again. My hotel room was so small it wasnt even a room. It was more like a cupboard. I have stayed in MANY Travelodges in the UK, and thought them to be fantastic at meeting my needs. This one wasnt fantastic, and didnt meet my needs. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “tired, but convenient”
Reviews.Author: MMackDevon
Reviews.Content: I travel to London a couple of times a year, arriving by train from the west country. Travelodge at Marylebone is my hotel of choice because I can walk to it from Paddington station. The hotel could do with a bit of a re-furb, the bathrooms especially are dates & a bit grubby & the plumbing is not great, however the beds are always exceptionally comfortable & the rooms are not too hot, there is no temperature control but the windows do open a bit, even on the upper floors. Quite a lot of outside noise but in central London I expect nothing less, no noise from inside the hotel from other guests or banging doors though. Friendly receptionist, quick check in. We did not eat in the hotel, there is a M&S & other shops in the train station across the road which have a good selection of food available.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in prison without the fun bits”
Reviews.Author: thesprat
Reviews.Content: My stay at the TL in Marylebone did not start well, I arrived at one in the afternoon to find an empty reception, there was a notice on the desk instructing callers to press the call button, after a bit of searching I discovered this was the page button on the phone, ( there was a large sign on this that had folded over and couldn't be read). Even after pressing the button I had to wait for the receptionist to appear, however when she did come out, she was very polite and helpful giving me all the information I needed for my stay. I went up in the lift to my room and found it immediately outside the lift on the second floor, this nice and close I thought how good is that, on opening the door I thought I'd stumbled into a cupboard by mistake, but no there in front of me was the bed. The bed was tucked under the draughty window and between both walls, yes both walls the room was (just) the width of the bed and only a little longer about 6ft by 8ft, the same as a prison cell... The walk in shower room had a built up door ledge that I tripped over twice during my stay, there was a curtain around the shower that could not be moved so sitting on the toilet involved wrapping yourself in shower curtain and it gave the room a massively claustrophobic feel. I didn't use the bar or restaurant, but went down for breakfast in the morning, unfortunately the cooked breakfast looked bad enough to put me off eating anything else and the coffee was too hot. On the plus side, the hotel is very cheap for central London and it is very well located next door to Marylebone station. Stay at the hotel if you are short or if you are planning on drinking enough to not care where you fall asleep.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest hotel but fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: kaatje57
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is pretty basic and some rooms are noisy. But it is always clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. If you manage to get one of their sale deals you really can't beat this place. Very central, buses to about anywhere in London stop 2 minutes away, underground 5 minutes walk and the train station across the road.Loads more places within walking distance. Shops everywhere and good places to eat. Have been here about 5 times and will certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you have only paid Â£40 for a room but definitely could do better”
Reviews.Author: artsman
Reviews.Content: This place is moderately grim with demoralised, faintly surly staff and the most peculiar lighting. Grey light if you get what I mean. The rooms are compact and the bathrooms are faintly grubby. A bedside light is broken (room 108 folks). The bed was comfortable enough for a night. The place isn't particularly noisy for central London and the location next to Marylebone station is good for visiting certain quarters of town. So if you can get a room cheaply enough grit your teeth and go for it, you won't find it too bad for a night but don't book if for your honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but in need of a refurb”
Reviews.Author: Philch1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on New Years Eve, paying Â£99 for a twin room. (A double is the same room, they just push the beds together). The location is excellent, right opposite Marylebone train and underground station. There are a few pubs over the road (inside the station) and others, plus a Tesco Express, 5 minutes walk away. I was impressed to find free wireless internet available in the reception area, otherwise everything about the hotel is cheap and cheerful. The room had a TV and tea & coffee available. Maintenance is clearly not a priority as there were 2 bulbs in our room that needed replacing. In general it's what you expect from a Travelodge - nothing too fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff. Fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: cazza999
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the Christmas period (24th to 27th December 2011). Got a super cheap saver rate, by booking in advance. The location is brilliant (right next to Marylebone train station & a short walk to Baker Street tube station), & dead easy to get to Oxford Street etc. We had a twin room, with a pretty view overlooking Marylebone station & the Landmark hotel. The bedroom was fine, quite spacious, comfortable beds. The heater worked well in warming the large room up, for a winter stay... but part of the double glazing was missing, so if it hadn't been Xmas (with less traffic), I think it could have been quite noisy from the street below. This is one of the older London Travelodges, so the bathroom was really old (they really need refurbishment)... I'm sure it was clean, but because it looked old & worn, it gives the appearance of seeming less clean. Anyway, the staff were absolutely lovely & ever so friendly & helpful (reception, bar/cafe, & breakfast room), so this made up for it - made it a very lovely stay. The food in the bar/cafe was delicious. The reception were brilliant - when checking in, the hot water didn't work, so they immediately moved us to another room. If you're a tourist, I'd recommend staying at one of the newer Travelodges (with a more modern bathroom, e.g. Covent Garden Travelodge, just to make your stay a bit more comfortable)... but if you're just stopping off in London for 1 night & can manage to get a cheap rate, this hotel is great for the location - but bear in mind it is old & basic now & does need refurbishing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cheap price, ok room”
Reviews.Author: AlisonJW
Reviews.Content: I guess how you review this hotel depends a lot on how much you paid, and I got an absolute bargain. I love the location and the room was clean, if a bit scruffy, with a broken bedside light and missing sink plug.plug. it was clean though, and quiet (I have stayed in a really noisy room here) and Hugo on the front desk was charming.

Reviews.Title: “Marylebone”
Reviews.Author: sandonred
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this Travelodge about 5 or 6 times for our wedding anniversary and have always enjoyed our stay of usually 4 or 5 nights to enjoy what the capital has to offer. This is by no means the best Travelodge London has to offer (it was another hotel chain prior to Travelodge purchasing and not a new build) but it is fairly centrally located and has good transport links within the capital and beyond with Marylebone underground and mainline station facing the hotel less than a minutes walk away. The staff are friendly and helpful which at times in London can be unusual!. There is plenty to do around the area to eat out and there is a sports bar facing which is good for a few drinks and catch any sports action. The waxworks is about a 5 minute walk away to Baker Street along with other tourist sites. A 20 minute walk will take you to Oxford Street and the surrounding areas which is quite pleasant in good weather early evening. The one thing I will say is that we have always opted for this hotel as they usually have the saver rates, I wouldn't pay the full price as although clean it is quite basic even for travelodge. Very good rating if you get a saver rate, average if you pay full price which at times could be Â£100 a night. We have eaten at the hotel and found it to be good and quite reasonable for London prices. A couple of times the Bakerloo line has been undergoing engineering work at weekends and Marylebone underground has been closed, you can easily walk from Baker Street for the jubilee and other lines but I would check in advance of your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel i ever stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: dickins road
Reviews.Content: OMG!!! this place is bad, i have never written a bad review but tis place is bad.. Paid for early check in, got there at 12 to find a big que, waiting for someone at reception, then they appeared and said i better go and check the rooms, gone for about 5 minutes,, all still waiting there. finally checked in 20 mins after arriving, Went to our room which was average, mould around the bath and shower broken mirror and just really tatty. We decided finally at 930pm to just go home and not stay in this hole so we got a train and slept in our own bed.....

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you get a cheap deal”
Reviews.Author: ABSWLondon
Reviews.Content: I got a fantastically cheap deal so based on what i paid i cannot complain at all. However, if i had paid the full whack i would have been a little disappointed. Good Points: Great location, right by Marylebone Station. Staff polite and helpful. Room clean. Not So Good Points: overall appearance of the room was shabby and tired, in dire need of some tlc. Not up to the usual Travelodge standard. Gave the impression it was a youth hostel which they'd altered and turned into ensuite rooms as cheaply as possible. Plywood chips etc clearly visible in bathroom. Bed was lumpy.

Reviews.Title: “Leaking light!!”
Reviews.Author: Katy C
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, as was the building. Quite noisy but that is to be expected with it's location so close to the train/tube. Even though it's a travelodge and from past experience myself and my partner have felt safe etc, we didn't in this one! .... My partner and I had left the building and re-entered several times without seeing anyone in reception etc, and with no key card needed to get into the lift or through the doors to where the rooms were located, we felt quite vulnerable. With every noise we both looked at the door! To top it of whilst we were sleeping (2.30am) we were woken to a VERY loud dripping noise. We turned the light on to find water pouring through a light in the room. We could hear the shower on above us and so we can only assume that it was leaking and came through to us. We were quite panicked about this because obviously water and electric aren't a good mix! We quickly got changed and ran down to reception, the receptionist, after ringing a couple of times (he was in a room behind reception so once again the front door was left unattended and not locked as people were coming in and out as we stood waiting), did come up and look at it. However, much to our surprise wasn't to fussed about it and then continued to 'TEST' the light! We couldn't believe what we were seeing... turning a light on which had water pouring out of it's casing... so not only was he risking an electric shock, but a fire aswell... BRILLIANT!! This left us with about 7 inches either side of the dripping water (and the growing puddle!!) to get around it and exit the room!! The receptionist offered us another room a few doors down, which on the other hand was fine, however because of the disruption we only had about 4 hours sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Godd little place”
Reviews.Author: Adrian Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights, very convenient location near the train station, breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you're a heavy sleeper...”
Reviews.Author: travelista20489
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on 11th & 12th Dec, first impressions were very good; got checked in quickly and received extra pillows, iron and hairdryer as I always ask for on arrival when traveling so I don't need to pack them, staff were polite, efficient and helpful. Nice, good size double room with small plasma TV, mini wardrobe and desk with the usual kettle and tea making facilities. Bathroom was decorated nicely with marble effect walls and everything working fine in terms of toilet, sink and shower although a bulb was out above the shower and the extraction fan did not work which is a must in a room with no windows apart from the ones that open about 4 inches in the main room. The shower was powerful and water was hot for a good while even after the morning rush and afternoon. The room overall was very good but I feel it was missing a main light on the ceiling as there was only one above the door and next to the window so could be dingy at times. The bed was in need of a new mattress as I woke up aching but for a sale room I couldn't complain really. The only major thing I had a problem with was the noise, I know London is a noisy place, I have stayed many times in various areas but this was particularly loud day and night, alright if you are a heavy sleeper but I have trouble sleeping at the best of times so this was a real problem. The Sunday night seemed to be fine, a little noisy during the day as expected and quieter at night but the Monday was bad, taxi's, vans, motorbikes and lorries seemed to drive past relentlessly until about 4am. I don't know if it was just that night but I'm imagining in is like it during the week as the Sunday was fine. All in all if I had paid the usual rate of around Â£80 I would have been a little annoyed but for a winter sale room it was unbeatable on price and the faults could be looked over especially in London and its close proximity to the station and taxi's (2 mins walk) and local Tesco Express (10 min walk max). Good service and room just the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality budget hotel in Central London”
Reviews.Author: MogirlLondon
Reviews.Content: London Marylebone Travelodge provided a surprisingly quiet place to stay in an incredibly convenient position which is opposite the rail station & a short to medium walk from Marylebone High St, Oxford Street, Park Lane etc. Of course traffic could be heard but then it's in the middle of London, nothing else could be expected. Otherwise though, it's a clean, safe & very pleasant hotel in an amazing position for a budget price.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the last train home!”
Reviews.Author: lukamandog
Reviews.Content: Dire, soulless and dismal. This was booked for a business stay over after a client event in London. Travelodge doesn't worry about niceities such as wifi and staff, count yourself lucky if you get a plug in your sink - 2 out of 4 of our group rooms didn't. What visitors to the Olympics next year will think of us, heaven only knows! We arrived before 3pm and were made to pay Â£10 extra to leave our bags in one room. Yet amother way to fleece the unsuspecting huest, as everyone expects check-in to be 2pm like almost everywhere else. I suspect this is a converted ofice block from the seventies, as the windows are single glazed, badly fitting alumunium type. As such the noise from the road ensured a disturbed nights' sleep. Breakfast is the usual cheap, nasty lowest cost version of everything in an overheated, over lit room with a stuck CD droning on. The only positive i can report is that at least it was reasonably clean and the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling - should have read the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: glenncork
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel for location and confidence of Travelodge name. Big mistake! Stayed one night in twin room, bathroom tiny and run-down, door didn't close let alone lock. 2 lifts, one with no light, the other was unreliable. Used stairs to 5th floor as we didn't trust the lifts, evidence of ?vomit on stairs, obviously not cleaned. Drink machine in Reception accepted money but didn't dispense. Receptionist aware of all these problems but there were no notices displayed. Charged Â£119 for this! Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to be positive!”
Reviews.Author: 999Newts
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this travelodge during a short overnight business trip. I was apprehensive as I'd read the reviews prior to travel. I accept that Travelodges will be basic and having stayed at a couple before thought I'd know what to expect. Problem is that although my twin room was adequate (although shabby and in dire need of renovation) the bathroom was filthy! Regardless of cost there is NO excuse for poor cleanliness. I was a little embarrassed as we had invited business guests. Breakfast was ok for the additional cost but Â£116 for this, London or anywhere, is a disgrace. Won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay while in london for location”
Reviews.Author: Geordie75_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel a few times through the cheap deals you get from travelodge and the cheapest we stayed here for two nights was Â£60, we could not find anything cheaper in the area. The location is brilliant for baker street and madame taussauds and it is a nice walk down to oxford street which takes around twenty mins, plenty of cafes, bars and shops on way. The hotel is across the road from marylebone train and tube station so access to the rest of london basically on your hotel room doorstep. Very quick checkin and the rooms are basic but its only a bed because why stay in your room when you got london outside. Try and get the travelodge offers for this hotel and enjoy the area

Reviews.Title: “Very basic room, poor value”
Reviews.Author: NeilT1960
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a business trip and was glad it wasn't longer! Some things were OK - check in was quick and the staff were helpful, breakfast was OK for the price (but not as good as the similarly-priced offering at Premier Inn) and the area is reasonably quiet for London, so I had an undisturbed night on the 4th floor. The problem with this hotel, though, is that the whole place is tatty, run-down and desperately in need of renovation. The public areas are seedy and worn, the lifts give the impression of being on their last legs (the whole control panel looked ready to fall off one of them!) My room, a single, was very small - I'm sure it had once been a cupboard in the hotel's better days. The decor was dull and grimy, the carpet worn and dirty. The bed was hard but I prefer that to a very soft bed. The pillows squashed flat as soon as I lay on them. The tiny shower room/toilet was done out like a 'wetroom' but don't think of anything flashy - the shower curtain clung to me both while showering and while using the toilet, and the drainage wasn't arranged properly so the water from the shower pooled around the base of the toilet. However the shower was hot and pretty powerful. Overall, then, a tatty run-down hotel which charges its guests over a hundred pounds a night for the 'privilege' of staying in very basic conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expcted”
Reviews.Author: MrsMon
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on trip advisor I was apprehensive about staying at this hotel. The only reason I booked it was because we went to a wedding across the road at the Landmark And it's location is so convenient. It was no where near as poor as I expected. The receptionist was polite and check in was quick. Whilst the decor is warn it is clean and I did not detect any unpleasant odours as mentioned by other bloggers. Our double room was spacious, clean with a very comfy bed and soft pillows. We heard very little noise during the night. Yes the bathroom had seen much better days but the water was hot, the hotels fine and how long do you spend in a bathroom anyway? The cost for a central London hotel was very cheap and all in all I was satisfied .

Reviews.Title: “Cor Blimey! What a shocker!”
Reviews.Author: Clarkey99
Reviews.Content: Read earlier reviews from 2007 and disappointed to say things haven't improved. Awful odour, tiny, tiny room...my feet touched the wall and I'm not the tallest. Understand that budget dictates choice but do yourself a favour and shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Pamlynne
Reviews.Content: I know it is a budget hotel but I do expect to have a plug in the bath, a shower that is actually not hanging off the wall and a sink tap that is in fact screwed down!! The bathroom was really, really bad. The tiles were cracked and broken, the grout was mouldy and the sealant was missing in places. The toilet roll holders were broken and so the toilet roll was left loose on the sink. The original plug was missing from the sink and had been replaced by a plastic one leaving a large gaping hole that looked ugly and was easy to drop things down. In the bedroom the decorative grill in front of the boxed in radiator was missing, leaving an ugly dirty area to look at. The bedside lights were hanging off and were unusable. The whole building, including the room stunk of cheap air freshener and gave me migraine. We stayed two nights and although the bin was emptied and towels replaced the beds were not made up. I have stayed in several Travelodge before and twice before in London and they have always been basic but OK. Usually a standard you can rely on. This has put me off ever using them again.

Reviews.Title: “Been to a lot better budget places”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel to watch the National Brass Band Championship Finals at the Royal Albert Hall - chose this hotel for the proximity to Marylebone station. Location itself is not too bad and is close to a few convenience shops including Tesco Express and M&S Simply Food, but is never quiet, even at night it was quite noisy even with the window shut (there is a bar on the corner of the street near Marylebone station), a lot to due with vehicle noise, obviously not the hotel's fault but the windows in the room were not great. Room size acceptable but lacked storage (for clothing, bags etc.) - and even though it is a budget hotel I would still expect a TV with Digital Channels (Freeview) - this only had 5 channels +2 digital channels. The lighting in the room was dreadful - there is an orange striplight behind the headboard (for effect??) and the bedside bendy reading "lamps" were worse, wouldn't stay up. Bathroom basic but ok and clean, can't adjust shower head though and does not help matters when you are 6' 4"! Towels were changed and beds made daily. Entrance hall to hotel looks quite nice but the corridors and lifts were dingy and had a funny smell... The evening meal food service was absolutely, truly awful - stay clear at all costs. We pre-booked/paid evening meals for the 2 nights we stayed there - we cancelled the 2nd evening meals and got a refund. Food was cold when arrived (sent it back - obvious microwave out of a pre made packet job) which we had waited 45 minutes, was far from fresh as the menu suggested and lacked vegetables etc. again as shown on the menu. "Dinner" is served in the hotel's dingy bar. We ordered Domino's pizza the next night!! Breakfast is better compared to the dinner and did have a wide range of cereals, cooked food, fruit etc. but is still hardly high scoring. The staff were quite friendly (it was not their fault the problems we had re: dinner) and were able to get us some extra pillows for our rooms. They managed to resolve our complaint without too much fuss. Overall i'd say it would be ample for a 1 night stopover if you just want B&B and it's in a good location - if you're planning to stay in London for more than 1 night then i'd suggest you find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “budget - another word for low standards?”
Reviews.Author: smiler8670
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing to say the least! Just because it's budget, it should still have the basics and be clean. First room we were given smelt terrible and when we drew back the curtains we knew why - the whole of the window surround was covered in black damp mildew! Asked to be moved which we were (after originally being told there were no other rooms on the same floor as our friends and ended up just 3 doors away from them!) but this was was only just a little better, i.e no damp! The bathroom was extremely small, the vent above the shower was thick with dust and cobwebs. When you turned the shower on, the water went everywhere despite using the shower curtain and to be honest it was need more than want that led us to use the shower. There was no sign of life when we went down to the bar before going out - we were beginning to come to the conclusion that it was self-serve! When we were eventually served, all 4 of ther glasses were smeared with greasey fingerprints and had to be changed. Hardly any of the staff spoke/understood very much English and when we got back from seeing our show, we could not get back in! Eventually let in by a member of staff leaving the downstairs bar. Breakfast - take it or leave it - probably better to grab a coffee and danish somewhere else to be honest. The best thing about this hotel was the fact that it was near the train/tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Camilla7818
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two nights on the top floor. The room was tiny, but clean. I had no problem storing my stuff and all my shopping. Bathroom was also small, and the water pressure was awful. It was almost impossible to rinse out my hair. :( The bed was on the firm side, but ok. Marleybone train station and underground are across the street, so it was very easy getting around the city and that is the main attraction for this hotel. The price was also nice for London, with Â£ 112,50 for two nights. I would probably stay here again or at one of the other Travellodges in London.

Reviews.Title: “Better to sleep on the street”
Reviews.Author: Global_Nomad_mideast
Reviews.Content: This is considered a 'Budget' hotel...but I guess they don't have enough of a budget to make it decent. - no phones in rooms. - no safe in room. - one day I got a towel with a hole in it. (see pics) - the wood around the bathroom sink was water damaged. (see pic) - there was no hook on the bathroom door, just a big patch of what used to be a hook. (see pic) - the shower was substandard. I could have stood in the London rain and gotten more wet than what was coming out of the shower head. Pathetic. - the lobby had this smell which reminded me of my grandmothers clothes. Not worth the price. The only good thing about it it was it location next to the tube. That's it.

Reviews.Title: “in need of tlc”
Reviews.Author: stevelincoln1
Reviews.Content: well positioned for getting around ,good selection of pubs -cafes within walking distance.but the hotel really needs a long over due make over. rooms clean - tidy but decor shabby and battered ,bathrooms held together with white filla - rooms noisy from traffic and the station over the road.lift out of action , breakfast ok but nothing to write home about ,so if you want it basic for a night or two do it but dont expect and frills .

Reviews.Title: “Brought down to beneath the usual Travelodge standard”
Reviews.Author: MikeWReading
Reviews.Content: For those who are not familiar with Travelodge, they are the RyanAir of the hotel world. They advertise that they are cheaper than Premier Inn '80% of the time' but in reality it is like comparing Asda with Marks & Spencer. At some point in the not too distant past they took over this hotel and rather than investing in its worn out facilities, just ripped out whatever fixtures and fittings were there and put instead the usual drab Travelodge chipboard 'furniture' and plastic (un)comfortable chair. They didn't even bother to repair the disgusting grouting the bathroom, and their 'Mr Sleep' can't have been here as it is so noisy because the windows facing onto a main road with Marylebone station opposite aren't even double glazed. But I expect all this because I have stayed in various Travelodges in the London area and it doesn't get much better except if the refurbishment is more recent or is a building that wasn't previously a hotel, it hasn't had time to get so tatty. Don't expect a phone in the bedroom, or staff to help with anything, you certainly won't get it here. If you want to check in you need to press the call button on the pager so that the receptionist (who may well be down the road buying cheap sandwiches at Tesco Express) will come back to assist you. Despite spelling my name carefully they tried to check me in as someone else. Only one of the two lifts was working (very shakily) - the other one was 'Temporary (sic) out of order' during both nights of my stay. I booked the two nights few weeks in advance for Â£25 a night, and for a hotel in central London it is very good value at that price. For the outrageous Â£250 a night advertised right now on the Travelodge website you will most certainly be extremely disappointed! The location is good, right next to Marylebone station and a few minutes walk from Baker Street with better tube connections. But it is sad to think how great it could be if Travelodge would fork out a little bit more rather than trying to maximise their profits all the time. Who can blame them really, that is obviously what they are in business for! P.S. If you've not stayed at Travelodge before, the things NOT to expect are: anything more than one tiny bar of soap in the bathroom. Bring your own shampoo; it is not supplied, neither are any other toiletries. They do make that clear on their website. You may or may not get more than one towel if you have booked a double room. You may or may not get more than two pillows in a family room. There is a TV fixed high up on the wall with a limited range of eleven TV and four radio channels. No phone in the room, you have to go all the way back to reception if you want to ask anything.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not so nice room!”
Reviews.Author: E85-P87
Reviews.Content: Although the Marylebone Travelodge was in a great location which mattered to us most, our room was terrible. The Bathroom was unclean and very warn (cracked mirror with a section missing, stained sink\bath, toilet wasn't fixed to the floor properly and wobbled when you sat on it). The bedroom wasn't fabulous either, the curtains didn't fit the windows properly, the skirting boards were missing, the door was stiff to open and close we must have woken the neighbors every time we went out and came in. Other than the room we had a fabulous time in London and if you do stay in this hotel it's a great location with the tube\train station literally over the road (we had a room facing the station and we didn't hear much noise during the night). I would also recommend eating at a little Indian restaurant about 5 minutes walk away called Romna, lovely food!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for an acceptable central London hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malc-at-York
Reviews.Content: Although it was perhaps a little more tatty than I would have expected for a Travelodge, it was handy and reasonably priced. Being a little further away from the main attractions and also from the Eurostar terminal seems to have held the price down when compared with other Travelodge's in London. Having said that, it was still in central London with Marylebone underground station virtually next door and Baker Street station (from where you can get to many destinations on the underground) only 500m away (and an easy straight walk too!). I only booked a single room and although it was small it was still large enough for me! I had no problem with the en-suite and being at the rear of the building I was spared the traffic noise (even with the window open all night). I skipped breakfast and so cannot comment on that but I didnâ€™t pay for it and so it didnâ€™t matter. However, 500m away at Baker Street station there is a Wetherspoons pub (the Metropolitan Bar - internally a magnicifent restored building) that opens at 9am (10am on Sundays) for very reasonably priced breakfasts (standard full cooked breakfast and a pint of orange juice for less that Â£7 if I remember! Stay there again? I definitely would! Accommodation like that normally costs more in central London!

Reviews.Title: “Such a shame, the old place is sadly in need of some TLC”
Reviews.Author: Caromel090
Reviews.Content: I returned back to what was once the Harewood Hotel, where I worked for 2 1/2 years back in the late 80's when it was privately owned and part of Best Western Hotels, to be sadly disappointed. I know it needs a refurb as much of the decor was done back then circa 1988, when the marble floors and bathroom tiling was installed! No net curtains in our room, very sparsely decorated, which I guess is what you get at a budget price but nets are a necessity when adjacent to an office block and a busy train station - thoroughfare of Harewood Avenue. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable and nice to have mugs instead of cups, but could have left us more milk cartons as you need plenty with a mug. We were prewarned about the lack of shower gel/shampoo so we packed some. Breakfast on the first morning was bearly warm, although plentiful, the croissants were stale too - we faired better on day 2 and enjoyed looking out onto the street from the alcoves in the restaurant. We were very put off by the fact that there was nowhere to leave luggage - we had to pay for a late check out, a rip off at Â£10! This is ridiculous, we were told they didnt' have the facilities, however I know there used to be a cupboard space under the stairs which was used for that purpose. Travelodge, you're having a laugh, this hotel is now soulless - I won't be hurrying back again I'm sorry to say.

Reviews.Title: “As you'd expect for the money, pod location”
Reviews.Author: mel_6688
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, great location, breakfast had good enough selection. Staff we met were friendly and everything was easy there. Bed was comfy, nice tv. Neither of us dared to even have a shower, bathroom needed an update! There was no shower gel or shampoo etc but there were tea and coffee facilities. Its not the best we've stayed in but exactly what we needed for one night!

Reviews.Title: “A little shabby but a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: jray2436
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a total open mind after reading some of the previous reviews on here, but I needed a room slightly last minute and I wasn't going to pay over the odds. Luckily I managed to get a room here for Â£35. Being a single traveller I was booked into a single room, yes it was small, but the bed was comfy enough, and the bathroom was fine. Yes there was marks and scuffs on the walls and windows, plus the lifts could have been better but for the price couldn't really grumble. One thing that did let it down somewhat was the apparent lack of staff - there was non around when I wanted to check out. When you did see them they were pleasant enough. Marylebone is a lovely little area - it's really nice and feels very safe walking between the hotel and the tube stations - be it Marylebone or Baker Street. I got a very quiet nights sleep - hearing the odd siren and train pulling into the station but you would never have throught you were in central London. If you can see past the minor issues and your merely after a bed then i'd definite recommend and I hope to use this hotel on my next trip if the pricing remains the same.

Reviews.Title: “Your average stay - get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Jessiemcgivern
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days and to be honest all we wanted was a place to sleep for 4 nights. Its basic but our room was clean and I couldnt grumble. The hotel was very hot and you couldnt open the windows very far - about 12 inches all in all so good job we took a small fan with us, but we grin and bear it. The breakfast was a disappointment, the full english was not to my liking, so we just stuck to toast. I wouldnt pay for that again, and I would just get up an go and eat elsewhere, as by the time you had eaten anything it was time for another shower anyway as it was so hot in there - unbearable. You would go down in vest and shorts as though you were abroad and then change into your jeans and sweater to go outside! The staff were very nice and pleasant, asked for extra pillows, spoons and mugs etc and they were there when we got back that day. The location is excellent - not even a minute walk from the tube, but very noisy as our room was on the front, so took a long time to get to sleep especially as we wanted the window open. Marylebone was nice to walk around and I went with my 12 year old daughter and I felt very safe coming back each evening at about 10ish even though the riots were going on just outside London! I would go back to this hotel in time, we are going again at Easter but I am going to try and stay in covent garden this time - now I know my way around!

Reviews.Title: “Has so much potential”
Reviews.Author: MapofBones
Reviews.Content: We first stayed here when it was the Jarvis and it was excellent. The location is fantastic right outside Marylebone tube and handy for the medical district as well as walking distance to many attractions. However this hotel fails to hit the top spot and by so little too. Firstly the room. This is the first time we've stayed in a Travelodge preferring Premier but at Â£169 for our usual hotel we opted for this at Â£80 as we only wanted a bed for the night. The room is sparse to say the least and reminded me of either a student room or a hostel. It would have been nice if the socket under the desk had actually got a cover to it rather than all the wires be bare and all the electricals were actually in the wall rather than just covered by coving - it makes the place look even more cheap. The inside of the door to the room (which also was very stiff to open) had obviously had a notice removed from it and it would have looked better if the rusty nails which had held it in place had also been removed. The door into the bathroom had been badly repaired and there was a general "can't be bothered" air to most of the details such as shining the taps and ensuring that the grouting was white and not black. The window itself (which actually had a hand print and other marks on when we arrived which we cleaned ourselves) didn't open much which wasn't that much of a porblem but I should imagine the 6 inch gap between the window and the frame on one side might cause problems in winter or when it rains really heavily. There was also no telephone - first time we've ever stayed in a room with no telephone. That said the bathroom itself was basically clean although the towels were well past their fluffy best (if I had them at home would be in the "rag bag" for cleaning use) but they were clean and smelt so. The bedding was also clean and fresh although I did notice a very small blood stain on the duvet cover which did lose them marks on this aspect. The bed itself was reasonable comfortable although we did experience stiff necks but this might be the fault of the rather flat pillows. Also one extra pillow is a bit mean and what I thought was a blanket turned out to be a bath sheet stored with the pillows. Odd. We did borrow an iron from reception and it worked well although when we went to return it there was nobody there and, despite ringing the "summon" bell as instructed, nobody arrived so we had to leave it in reception. We noticed that there was nobody on reception a lot of the time and you'd wander past queues of people waiting for somebody to arrive so you could check in. Not good although it has to be said very little staff were in evidence apart from the service in the bar which was good. Secondly, we didn't have breakfast but did have something to eat in the bar. It's a bit functional but the food itself was reasonable and also good value for this part of London. Beer was a bit expensive although the waitress did point out the 2 for Â£6 offer on cider but we're not both cider drinkers. All in all this hotel has fallen in standard compared to when we last stayed which is a crying shame as with a bit of TLC and effort given it's position it could be an absolute jewel in Travelodge's crown. This was the first time we've stayed in a Travelodge and to be quite honest if they're all of this standard I think we'll pass. Fine for a one night stay if all you need is a bed but if you're planning a weekend despite it's location you might get a bit fed up of the ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location! Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: shezwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a three night leisure break. Excellent value for money, clean room and close to the underground. The hotel is a little dated but very clean!superb room rate for central London!

Reviews.Title: “A Festering Pit of a Hotel Staffed By Incompetents”
Reviews.Author: Jorganmeister
Reviews.Content: My own fault for continuing to put financial savings above basic enjoyment but I think I have finally learned after yet another dismal Travelodge experience. Focusing first on the bare facts, the hotel is a dump. The rooms are dirty, there are broken tiles and mould in the bathrooms, layers of dirt on the walls and it feels like a 1960s office block that has never been updated. Our room (105) was massively noisy and the "double glazing" made little difference to the noise. Moving on to the staff, we had two rooms booked for three nights each, both under my name, but booked separately, because this used to be the only way that the best room rate could be guaranteed. We confirmed this on check-in and were told that this would be no problem, we just needed to get our key cards re-swiped each day. We did this, although the first time took 15 minutes because the staff member didn't know what he was doing. On returning for our third night, one of our party found that his room had been totally emptied of all his possessions. These had been placed (all together - clean clothes, dirty clothes, toothbrush, phone charger) in a used carrier bag and labelled "lost property"). We are in the process of complaining formally about this but I am determined never to use Travelodge again if I can possibly avoid it, unless I have visited the hotel before and am slightly confident that it won't be a hideous slum like this property. Unless you are desperate to save money, avoid this like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: BenchDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for and at London prices this was good value. Room 314/414 were good and quiet. Overall the hotel was badly in need of refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for what you pay.”
Reviews.Author: Criddmeister
Reviews.Content: Stayed in May 2011 for one night. Basic, but spotlessly clean. Only letdown was the receptionist who asked us to wait for someone else to come and help us, while she went outside the front door if the hotel for a cigarette!!! Sadly, there was nobody else to help us, and we had to wait until she'd finished her break. Otherwise, fair hotel for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Pity about the dodgy plumbing....”
Reviews.Author: Andy62_11
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend at this hotel, it is the 3rd time we have stayed here and we knew what to expect from a Travelodge hotel, hence we where not dissapointed by the hotel but by the toilet! If they offer you room 210, ask them if the toilet seat will stay up!!!! We had to hold it up or rest it against our back when using the toilet, not the best, obviously somebody has cut corners to make it fit but a proper back to wall toilet would be better. Otherwise 4 nights, Fri to Tues for Â£140, fantastic! And it is next to Marylebone Tube & Railway Station making it very easy to gey anywhere in London.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, fuctional, but deperately in need of renovation, atrociously rude staff”
Reviews.Author: KennethTan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is simple and functional like any other Travelodge. While they have renovated some parts of the room, it is obvious that the hotel is desperately in need of a complete renovation. It looks like parts of the hotel has not seen any work done to them since when the property was built, probably back in the 1960s. Some of the staff were atrociously rude! Try getting service and you will end up with the staff arguing with you for no apparent reason! Location wise, it is good, being located just across the street from Marylebone station. There is an M&S at Marylebone station, a Tesco around the corner (diagonally on the other end of the same block), and another Tesco down the street from Marylebone station, about 2 min walk away. But being in the Marylebone area, places for food are rather limited in choice and expensive. I didn't find noise from traffic, delivery trucks, rubbish trucks, etc. being a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not that wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Eprocbell
Reviews.Content: Whilst this hotel offers great rates, it does have some rather obvious areas of improvement for your average businessman I feel. The entrance lobby feels like you're walking into a YMCA. Vending machines and two internet terminals that partly block the passage to the lifts doesn't give a great first impression. I'm quite sure this is all intentional but for me, it just feels a bit...wrong. The rooms are very, very basic but equally, clean and tidy. Travel lodge claim to strip things back in order to preserve best rates but one measly block of student-looking soap and no in-room water re-affirmed my initial YMCA feeling. The in-room internet was rubbish and further irritated me with the advance coupon I purchased just not working. I gave up and just purchased a further 24 hours online but my work was impeded with speed equivalent to snail-pace. Unforgivable considering their location and access to high-speed services. And to top it all, the hotel, amazingly, doesn't store bags. At all. Ever. I asked whether I could just leave my bags for a few hours after checking out and was met with a "can't do that - sorry, it's do to with insurance". That's just plain bonkers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value if what you want is a room”
Reviews.Author: TouristKing1212
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews I felt the need to write my own. Lets be straight if you what you want is an upmarket, fancy hotel with bells and whistles this is not it! What you are paying for is an excellent location, security, a room with a bathroom - and you're not paying very much either! The value is brilliant. If you wanna save your money and use your savings to dine at the best restaurants (using your saved money) this is a great hotel. You wont get a porter open the door; carry your luggage and call you 'sir'. If you want that, don't come to this hotel, pay 90% more and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive & poor standards, only good was the price of the peroni beer”
Reviews.Author: Hooty0000
Reviews.Content: Dirty rooms had stains on my pillow, difficult to check in and expensive to stay at least for me Â£145 p night. One bright point was the full English breakfast, is was adequate

Reviews.Title: “Good value basic hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kirsty1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2011 and paid Â£95 for a room without breakfast. Given the location - right beside Marylebone station, I thought this was an excellent price. Location felt safe for central London - I was walking around at 10pm and no dodgy characters were about. Rooms very bland but clean. If you don't have high expectations and simply need a room to stay overnight in this is a good option. I had the breakfast at Â£6 but felt this was a waste of money as it was simply hideous - I think you'd be better popping to a nearby starbucks/prets and buying coffee and a pastry.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Takethis
Reviews.Content: You know what you are getting with Travelodge it should be cheap cheerful and clean. There is absolutely no excuse for the rooms and bathrooms not being clean. The bathroom was a disgrace, net curtains filthy, window safety catches broken. No air conditioning there have to keep windows open at night equals very noisy. Beds have gone past their sell by date. The whole hotel is very tired and needs a total refurb. You cannot drop your bags off without having to pay for an early check in which is Â£10 extra! No hairdryer in the room you have to borrow one. To cap it all the fire alarm went off due to a fault on the board which they knew about and blamed it on the engineer - the roll call was a shambles. Will definitely not be staying there again even if you paid me.

Reviews.Title: “Tatty, noisy but good location... shame”
Reviews.Author: hobsonz
Reviews.Content: I never expect too much at these types of hotels but this one was bad. The bathroom was falling to pieces, a new sink had been fitted into an old cabinet and there were holes everywhere - the shower which was in front of a badly painted frosted glass window was next to useless - and it just felt dirty. The room was on the noisy corner with traffic all night long - it was extremely hot and as it faced East the sun in the morning came through the holes in the curtains! On the positive side the breakfast wasn't bad. We also found it hard to believe that although the check in was 3pm we arrived at 2.15 to be told that a charge of Â£10 would be made to check in early! We just went to the pub and had a beer... we checked out early perhaps I should have asked for a refund? The lift was filthy - I wouldn't touch the buttons and I am not that fussy! Don't use this place unless you are desperate and Travelodge get your act together and do this place up - what a poor perception of UK standards foreign travellers must get!

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here if you want a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: AQuill
Reviews.Content: Worked booked me into this hotel because of the location. Location is the ONLY positive about this hotel. Single rooms measure 6ft x 8ft and the bathroom is so small you cant even open the toilet lid fully! No plug in the (dirty) sink, and worse of all I was bitten by bed bugs.... My advise? Sleep tight??? you wont sleep at all here. DREADFUL. Stay somewhere else..

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent for underground connections”
Reviews.Author: dowewanttogoback
Reviews.Content: Pretty standard single room... be prepared for it to be small but well formed! The toilet doubles up as a wet room too, so be careful of where you place the toilet roll or it could end up very soggy- the same with having a shower, creating a wet floor, then getting dressed and needing to use the toilet!!! In fairness, my brother-in-law had a family room here last year that was very spacious and light. Breakfast is buffet style and good value for money for Central London & could happily set you up for the day!! Cannot fault the current deal- Up to 2 children up to 15 eat FREE with ONE PAYING ADULT!! Superb value for money. A combination of cereals, continental & full cooked on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: shopiloz
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location to explore London. The station and underground are minutes away but if you prefer taxis there is a huge rank outside the station. The hotel is fairly basic - TV, small bathroom, but the beds are lovely. I was slightly worried about the noise level but there was no problem whatsoever. The breakfast was very nice and set you up for the day! The reception staff were helpful and friendly, and great value rooms for London. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Harry186332
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel and was greeted by a pleasant efficient receptionist. I had booked a single room which was small, as expected, but clean and in good order. The bathroom was also clean and in good order. The bed was fine and the room quiet during the night so there was no problem sleeping. At breakfast there was a good choice of food well prepared and well presented in a room which was pleasant, clean and tidy. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge? I think not..more like dumplodge!”
Reviews.Author: WeymouthKatis
Reviews.Content: I have to start off with the fact that I have stayed in many a travelodge and always had a good stay, basic, no frills but clean and comfortable, worth the money. Then I had the misfortune to stay at the Marylebone Travelodge! Thinking that you know what you get with a Travelodge was the biggest mistake! The hotel is in DIRE NEED of some TLC and I cannot believe that it was supposedly revamped 5 years ago. I also can't believe that Travelodge are not doing anything about this hotel. You walk around the hotel not wanting to touch anything! Both rooms we had were very shabby - dirty 'white' walls, loose sockets, very lumpy bed, no remote control for the tv (and the buttons for it were right on the top of the tv - you had to stand on the end of the bed on tiptoes), cups we'd used for coffee were left there and not replaced. The bathroom smelt of mouldy, wet dog and when we used the sink, you had about 3 seconds of water draining before the water backed up and started filling up the sink (with various bits of yuck coming up at you). The toilet roll holder was falling off the wall, the extractor fan didn't work and there was mildew in the tile grout. Staff clearly didn't give two hoots about the hotel; when notified about the sink (as we were staying 2 nights), we were written on a piece of paper - no 'I'll get someone to see to it'. Returning 6 hours later, the sink was no better. It really is a grotty, hotel - one that shouldn't have the travelodge name. Its only saving grace is how close it is to the station but that doesn't justify the cost. I would hate for people to stay here, only taking notice of the more favourable reviews that are listed. If you are used to clean, well looked after hotels then you'll be in for a shock in this one!

Reviews.Title: “Saying this hotel is basic is an understatement”
Reviews.Author: Negraflor
Reviews.Content: Saying this hotel is basic is an understatement. There is no even soap in the bathrooms, no ventilation or air conditioning meaning you have to keep a mini corner window open and get all the buzz and noise of central london at night and day. There is dirt from the moment you arrive in the hotel, in the stairs, the lift, the doors, is like it has never been cleaned. The room cleaness was limit, probably the only reason why I decided to stay at the end, but the first impression was really shocking. Then I guess the experience wasn't helped much by the unhelpful staff. There are 2 black ladies at reception who are unbelievably rude and one chinese who can barely speak any english. The only positive thing about this hotel is that is right in front of Marylebone station, but still that does not justify charging prices of a 3-4 start hotel!!. NOT RECOMMENDED AT ALL.

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers.”
Reviews.Author: BlackpoolTinkerbell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very grotty, hardly any staff to be seen, one lift out of order, beds very uncomfortable, We got talking to two ladies whose rooms bathrooms were full of mould. If we hadn't paid up front we would have checked out. We have stayed at other Travellodges and been satisfied. AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: taylinYork
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a number of London travelodge's and this was one of the best. Well located opposite the Marylebone train and underground station, meant we could be in the hype of the West End in 5 minutes. The road passing the hotel was relatively quiet and although we were given a room facing onto the road, double glazing adequately kept the noise out. The rooms and bathrooms were clean and the shower very powerful and hot. Although we never went there was a bar in the hotel serving food and drinks, which also looked nice. The amenities of the train station were handy just over the road with a few shops, cafes and a sports bar. It was a Travelodge and cheap and cheerful but far better than some of the other London ones. Picking a travelodge in London choose this one or Southwark as they are both great value in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Paid far too much for this basic 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanielleLeeds
Reviews.Content: We booked with travelodge for the first time after friends told me the hotel chain was reasonable for the price you pay. Unfortunately we booked within 2 weeks of our visit so ended up paying 75 pounds per night. For that amount of money I expected a clean, modern room and a well staffed safe hotel. We got a very basic room for our money with a very old shower with broken tiles, no staff were found at the front desk most of the time and anyone off the street could have entered the hotel and travel to the rooms ( you did not need to use your hotel key to access the lift). We had the hotel breakfast which looks amazing on the website but in actual fact was cold and fairly sparse for the 7.95 we paid each morning. Marylebone was a great place to stay its very central but quite noisy, we were expecting this however so it wasnt too much of a problem. If you can book this hotel for less than 50 a night i think you will have a bargin but dont waste your money on the breakfast. There is a marks and spencer at the station, we bought food from there and would say just grab something there for breakfast instead of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible tired hotel that fails even to meet Travelodge's basic standards.”
Reviews.Author: simon_hedges
Reviews.Content: Where to start... I have stayed in a number of Travelodge's but never one even nearly as bad as this. Both lifts are currently broken. The rooms are dated and dirty. There are dirty patches around the sockets and light switches in the rooms. The bathrooms are tired. Ours has loose tiles on the floor, a loose basin tap and the basin doesn't drain properly. The only positive so far is that the shower works well. It seems like the double glazing only goes to the second floor so its really noisy on the floors above. The window restrictors are broken in both the rooms we have. It feels like no one cares about this hotel or the service it provides. This hotel is not even worth it's low price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location shame about the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lancaster59
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had booked two nights in this travelodge whilst we visited London to do the usual touristy things. I booked it on the merit of other Travelodges I have stayed in - Oh do I wish I had run it through Trip advisor first!!! The hotel is dirty and desperately in need of a revamp. The room was bare, bathroom needed new fittings and the windows needed replacing. It was noisy but we were next to the railway station so maybe you can't have it both ways. The breakfast was cheap in more ways than cost. The cutlery and mugs were dirty and when I asked one of the girls for a clean spoon and fork she promptly wiped it with a filthy tea towel! The cooked food was tepid and not replaced/topped up needless to say we didn't have another meal there. One of the lifts was out of order all the time we were there and on the first day both lifts were out of order - not good when you are on the 5th floor and have spent all day walking! All in all not worth the Â£140 we paid oh but on a positive note the bed was comfy but that was the only plus! Go somewhere else there is a Premier Inn just by Euston Station.

Reviews.Title: “location!”
Reviews.Author: ricwoo2008
Reviews.Content: At 50Pounds per night this location is excellent; yes, the rooms are ver small and the place could do with a refurbish but when the alternative - across the road - is 250Pounds per night the this Traveloegd is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: SiTaylor
Reviews.Content: Although this budget hotel has a great location right opposite London Marylebone station, the hotel is one to avoid. My room was dirty (long hairs in my bed, dirty bathroom, split floor tiles, stained carpets) and the staff were even worse. To check-in is usually a straightforward task - and the first point that a hotel can show its hospitality. Unfortunately, the person who served me could speak little English, charged my card incorrectly two times before getting it right, and managed to give me the wrong invoice. Not a smooth check-in process. Oh... and don't forget the smell in all public areas and the emergency lighting on the stair cases that was out of action. One to avoid if you can help it.

Reviews.Title: “Just plain shabby”
Reviews.Author: meh-whatever
Reviews.Content: It really shows that this is some old hotel bought and cheaply converted to the Travelodge brand. Very small single room, with an unstoppable draught from the old, ill-fitting window and ineffectual heating. I used one towel to seal the gaps in the window and another as a much needed extra layer of bedding! The bathroom wasn't exactly dirty but it was old and worn with heavy limescale and tatty fittings. Cafe Bar is a tiny windowless room in the basement serving lacklustre food so I'd suggest you don't book meals as part of your stay if you do come here. Generally I'd say avoid this hotel - go for one of the proper, newer Travelodges at Euston or King's Cross instead unless you're desperate for a cheap room. Only worth considering if you can get a Â£10 or Â£19 deal and just need a one night bolthole.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Travelodge, Good Value but lacking the basics”
Reviews.Author: SCOTT2704
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many, many Travelodge Hotels throughout the UK and indeed in most of the London ones too. I don't expect Radisson or Marriott quality due to price paid for the room and it's location in the upper market area of Marylebone, London but I do expect my basic expectations to be met !! The reception area and staff were fine and then I went upto my room. There were loose floor tiles and loose and missing ceiling tiles in the bathroom and the hot water took an age to warm up. The bath desperately needed re-sealing with Mastic whicj simply made it look grubby and dirty as did the very worn taps and mirror. In the room itself, most was ok except for the badly repaired ceiling which looked as though it had suffered a recent leak. The windows need replacing NOW as you can hear absolutely everything outside, although it wasn't overly noisy. Beds were also particularly uncomfortable and as I stated earlier, I am a regular Travelodge visitor and am not usually this critical. Basically the Marylebone Travelodge is in a fantastic location but is in need of a major spruce up and renovation to bring it in line with some of the chains newer hotels.

Reviews.Title: “travelodge should be ashamed”
Reviews.Author: fancyapint0
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel, we had stayed at several travelodges before so new they were low budget accomodation but were not prepared for this. Got to the hotel and the smell of oil and fat greated us at the door it was overpowering and disgusting. Our room was not ready even though we had paid extra to book in early but the overworked receptionist was polite and apologised. We got into our room the smelll continued all the way to the room it was really bad. Once in the room, their was a big whole in the ceiling in the bathroom and an extractor fan that had fallen off and it was filled with dirt, greaseetc. The bath was brown and had stains all down it, their were no plugs and the sink was black with grime. The carpets were old grimey and dirty, their was paint on the floor from some attempt at decoration. For Â£100 per room it was worse than a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Shoebox room -very low budget”
Reviews.Author: MissElly1206
Reviews.Content: Tiny room, basic decor, toilet didn't flush properly, dribble of water from the shower, taps in basin kept spitting out water so problems with water pressure in my room and my colleagues next door. Room 605/606 are a disgrace, noisy room, awoken by drilling outside,felt dirty even after having a shower. Mouthful of air freshener on entrance.YUK this was just the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SMC1990
Reviews.Content: The room was a good size and although it was next to a main road, you couldn't hear much noise. The shower kept losing power and wasn't of the best quality. Deliveries at 5am woke us up, which was not appreciated. Very close to Marylebone underground which was good, with access to an M&S Simply Food shop next to that until 11.45pm. The bar cafÃ© was very small and had to go to reception in order to get someone to serve us. The breakfast was average but as it had been left out for a while, it wasn't to the highest standard and I don't feel it was worth over Â£7. Overall, it was a good hotel if you just plan to sleep there, but I wouldn't recommend it for any stays longer than 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “over-priced at Â£100”
Reviews.Author: cpobyrne
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I knew this would be basic...but boy was it basic! Strong smell of bleach/detergent in the reception area. Single room was not much bigger than a wardrobe. Toilet seat broken. I think it was way over-priced at Â£100, but I don't stay in London often. On the plus side this is a great central location - walking distance from Regent park. The breakfast wasn't bad either.

Reviews.Title: “People writing the bad reviews should remember how little they paid!”
Reviews.Author: vesperalley
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine. No its not the Ritz... its not even a Holiday Inn but it is CHEAP!! If you read most of the negative reviews most of them are in relation to the noise, small bathroom or staff. What does that matter?... I found the noise at the Hilton in New York annoying too but that cost me Â£250 a night for the privilege! We paid Â£32 a night to stay here! (oh and by the way we had no noise at all). The only issue I had was having to wait 10 minutes.... yes 10 minutes!! until the clock said 2:30 so that we could check in. We arrived at 2:20 and were told we had to wait! Trivial but if thats the rules then so be it... Just found it trivial and annoying but it wouldn't stop me going back The rooms are clear and the beds have fresh sheets on. The bathrooms are clean and so are the towels. The staff don't go out of their way to be over the top but they basically so all that is required! Its not like they have much else to offer you.....ITS A TRAVELODGE!!! Have stayed her about 5 times. Its a room & shower and if your wanting more than that your going to have to double/treble you budget and stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but noisy”
Reviews.Author: adnil4skiing
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cheap and located across the street from Marylebone Station. These are the good points. If you want a good sleep then this is not the place for you. The area seemed noisy up until about 1am and then again from 4am onwards. The hotel was also very noisy at 4am (very loud group of people). However, it wins out on price and location and I will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “travelodge which is centrally located in london”
Reviews.Author: bren53
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in this well located hotel and was happy to take advantage of one of there special room sales which meant i was able to get two nights for Â£32. The rooms are spacious and clean with television tea coffee making facilities in the room also en-suite. This hotel is ideal for me as i flew into Stansted Airport and used the easybus non stop from statsted to baker street station which is only 10 minute walk from this hotel. As hotels are expensive in London i would say it represent excellent value at anything upto Â£60 a night i also had the buffet breakfast and found it very good value with plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: Jezster
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a few UK Travelodges and most have been consistently good, so I have to say I was disappointed with this one. On the positive side, the location is pretty good, right next to Marylebone Station, and not far from Baker Street and Edgware Road. Also, the room was clean, had a flat-screen TV on the wall, and the bed's mattress was comfortable. However, on the negative side, which more than outweighed the positive, some of the furnishings and decor were rather worn, including a large hole in the bathroom wall next to the toilet.
